bibl.title: Translation [from Spanish] of letter from J.F. Rodriguez-Perez to Philip Showalter Hench, August 9, 1941

div1.p: Rodriguez-Perez informs Hench that the Finlay Institute's copy of the history of Military Hospital No. 1 is the only one they have. He is not willing to lend it to Hench, but can have it copied. See Spanish orignial.

div1.head: Translation [from Spanish] of letter from J.F. Rodriguez-Perez to Philip Showalter Hench, August 9, 1941
div1.p:
I have received your kind letter of July 18 reminding me of your
visit to this library which caused me so much pleasure, when you were
in your investigations about the history and conquest of yellow fever.
I have tried to find for you a duplicate of the history of the Hospital
No. One of Galliol, 1903 but unfortunately I have not been able to get
it. The copy we have in our library is the only one and that is the
reason I am not able to send it to you as I would like to.

Nevertheless, we can send you photostatic copies of the pages
which are of more interest to you.

By separate mail I am sending you a copy of the “Revista de
Medicina y Cirugia de la Habana” of September 10, 1921. On page 554
there is an article about the old Hospital Number One which is now called
General Calixto Garcia. This number I am sending you of this journal
has a great historical value, but I am sending it to you as a present.
div1.closer:
Yours truly, Dr. J. F. Rodriguez Perez
Director de la Seccion de Publicaciones
Cientificas y Biblioteca.
